column4: Does anyone know how to change size of / partition with 12.04 beta2 installed? Can I only resize the volume during install?
use the gparted live cd, but you may have to mount the root partition and edit the /etc/fstab file to get the boot working correctly
yes, http://gparted.sourceforge.net/
you will not using whats currently installed on your machine, you need a live cd/usb
so that cleared the apt-get cache?
yes, the downloaded .debs
OSError: [Errno 28] No space left on device: '/tmp/aptdaemon-frozen-statusqkH8rX'
is your /tmp on / ? try removing some files to free up space
30 GiB is large enough, IMHO
no
So I am trying to remove some stuff through the software center and it tells me the same thing, I/O error:there is no space left
try: sudo apt-get clean
I did that, just try again?
yeah, it should have cleared some space
thanks man, I love learning new things. Got an different error this time.http://paste.ubuntu.com/930696/
seems the software center fixed it
the unebootin livesub won't boot
of what iso?
gparted-live-0.12.1-1
i *think* that ubuntu includes gparted on the live cd, so if you have a bootable ubuntu cd/usb, try booting it up and looking for it in the application list
that makes sense, i'll download the .iso again
